benchmark_details.name: IndoHateMix
benchmark_details.overview: IndoHateMix is a diverse, high-quality dataset capturing Hindiâ€“English code-mixing and transliteration in the Indian context, providing a realistic benchmark to evaluate model robustness in complex multilingual scenarios where existing NLP methods often struggle.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a realistic benchmark for hate speech detection in code-mixed Hindi-English contexts.

data.source: Curated from the Koo microblogging platform, targeted at accounts likely to generate hate speech.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by three expert annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on standard performance analysis comparing model outputs against annotated dataset labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 scores reflect better performance in detecting hate speech.
methodology.baseline_results: LLMs such as LLaMA3.1-8B achieved accuracies of 83% on IndoHateMix.
